newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia to float DM 108 mln shares in Koncar.
newsitem.headline: Croatia to float DM 108 mln shares in Koncar.

text.p: Croatia will float shares in electrical concern Koncar Elektroindustrija with a face value of 108 million German marks at home and abroad, the government's chief public relations officer said on Friday.
"(Croatian bank) Zagrebacka Banka and Deutsche Morgan Grenfell of London have been appointed to coordinate the offering," Milovan Baletic told Reuters.
He said the decision was passed at a cabinet meeting on Thursday.
The shares to be offered to Croatian and foreign investors will come from the Croatian Privatisation Fund portfolio.
The fund was put in charge of all the preparations but there was not date yet for the proposed issue, Baletic said.
Koncar's equity is valued at 365 million marks, making the size of the issue just under 30 percent.
The group, in which Germany's Siemens and Saudi firm Nesma have tiny stakes, sees it 1996 net profit in the region of 14 million kuna, little changed from a year earlier.

Koncar said last month it hoped to be privatised by the end of 1997. Plans to year 2000 also include a listing on the Zagreb Stock Exchange and on a foreign bourse to follow in the steps of the leading pharmaceutical company Pliva.
The government had first privatised Pliva through a global flotation in March 1996. It controls over 60 percent in Koncar through the privatisation agency and two state pension funds.
